emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Code Synthesis
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems capable of writing entire software modules from high-level requirements, reducing human involvement to oversight and strategic decision-making.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces demand for entry-level coding jobs, pushes human developers towards more creative and strategic roles, potential for increased software innovation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires trust in AI accuracy, regulatory acceptance of AI-generated code, and integration into existing development workflows.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuromorphic Chips
emerging_technologies.description: Processors designed to mimic the brain's architecture, significantly increasing AI's ability to handle complex, adaptive tasks with lower energy consumption.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to smarter, more efficient AI systems, impacting job automation, privacy issues, and ethical considerations around AI decision-making.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires advancements in hardware manufacturing, integration into existing tech ecosystems, and overcoming skepticism regarding AI's true cognitive abilities.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Air Mobility
emerging_technologies.description: Electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) vehicles for urban transport, fully autonomous with integrated AI for traffic management.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces urban congestion, changes urban landscapes, potential for social stratification based on access to air mobility.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires regulatory approval, public trust in autonomous flight, and infrastructure development for vertiports.

emerging_technologies.name: Blockchain for Energy Trading
emerging_technologies.description: A decentralized energy trading platform where individuals can buy and sell renewable energy directly, optimizing energy distribution and usage.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes energy independence, reduces carbon footprint, but requires widespread adoption of smart meters and energy storage solutions.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory frameworks, consumer education on blockchain technology, and integration with existing energy infrastructure.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Pair Programming
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that work alongside developers, providing real-time suggestions, debugging, and learning from the developer's coding style.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Highly adopted in software development teams, with integration into most IDEs and becoming a standard tool for productivity enhancement.

mainstream_technologies.name: Space Habitats
mainstream_technologies.description: Modular habitats for long-term human habitation in space, with life support systems, renewable resources, and autonomous maintenance.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Used in space missions, with early commercial applications for space tourism and research.

epoch_themes.description: A period where autonomous technology becomes ubiquitous, from transport to daily home appliances.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Significant impact on employment, urban planning, and personal independence, with ethical and privacy concerns.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rise in demand for engineers specialized in AI and autonomous systems, regulatory frameworks for AI governance.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on technologies that promote sustainability, reducing environmental impact through energy efficiency and resource management.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Shift towards greener economies, changes in energy consumption patterns, and potential new energy markets.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased investment in green technologies, international agreements for sustainability, and consumer demand for eco-friendly products.
